intro: Pardanthus nepalensis, commonly known as the Himalayan starwort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in a star-like arrangement, giving it its common name. Pardanthus nepalensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
